 Try Patrick J. Buchanan's The Death of the West: How Dying Populations and Immigrant Invasions Imperil Our Country and Civilization.

The thing with extreme left and right-wing thinkers, is that they are often trouble.
 Look at Communism, especially the USSR; how many people died in the purges and starvation.
 Look at Fascism, ie Hitler, and look how many people dies because of his nationalistic views. Left wingers and right wingers are never going to appeal to everyone. Left wingers want equal status, so working classes like them, but no-one likes to be equal to someone else. There will always be thick people and clever people, so you need different school to supply their needs. Right-wingers are nationalists, so the natives will like them, but then a massive clamp down on immigrants and immigration follows.

I think Immanuel Wallerstein is a fairly good extreme left winged author. His Race, nation and class makes a relative good argument for the world system theory. As for right-wing authers, I would suggest some of the classics; Ludwig Von Mises "Liberalism" or perhaps something from Robert Nozick.

 skip all the recommended books and read history instead.
 pay particular attention to the human crisis in history, how and why it arose, who were affected most and least, and how it have been addressed for better and for worse, and the long term consequences.
 then you would be better able to disregard artificial labels, which can be misleading oftentimes, and judge for yourself.
 keep an open mind honed by curiosity and tolerance with questions of "why"

Right-wingers are nationalists, so the natives will like them, but then a massive clamp down on immigrants and immigration follows.

 
 Not neccessarily, you can just as easily have left wing nationalists (look at the UK's BNP for instance), or right wingers who support immigration.
 
 As Eddie suggested, Ludwig von Mises presents an intelligent right wing case, you may also be interested in Ayn Rand.
